data:
{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3591816,"name":"Emmett Sisson","username":"emmettds","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T14:21:40.141Z","cooked":"

My team’s Reefscape robot was running MAXSwerve with Vortexes and NEO 550s this season. I’m curious if there’s a quantifiable limitation of MAXSwerve only allowing 550s to be the turning motors or if there is a noticeable point of diminishing returns? On top of that, has anyone modified their own modules to allow for a turning motor that is not a 550? We had an absurd number of issues with those little things this season that the idea of removing them from our future robots is a possibility. Thanks!!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T14:21:40.141Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":281,"readers_count":280,"score":75.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Emmett Sisson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3591971,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T16:00:59.850Z","cooked":"

A bigger motor will definitely fail less often. There are probably performance costs, too, but I don’t think they’re massive.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T16:00:59.850Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":73.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3591988,"name":"Adam","username":"noodleeater99","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/noodleeater99/{size}/258644_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T16:16:53.954Z","cooked":"

We just finished our third season with MAX swerve. Yea, NEO 550s are tiny and awful, especially when it comes to those fragile encoder cables. We’re currently looking into either switching to CTRE Minions for turning, which would require a custom adapter, or jumping ship and investing in Mark 4i. I’ll be sure to update this thread if we end up developing a Minion adapter.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T16:16:53.954Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":251,"readers_count":250,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Adam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74970,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592027,"name":"Emmett Sisson","username":"emmettds","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T16:57:51.608Z","cooked":"

Completely switching over to a different swerve system is what I want to do, but the price tag to do so is no joke (especially after spending as much as we have on MAXSwerve). I’m thinking about working on an adapter to use a regular NEO since we’ve got a ton of those laying around.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T16:57:51.608Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":43.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Emmett Sisson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"noodleeater99","name":"Adam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/noodleeater99/{size}/258644_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592057,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T17:21:11.788Z","cooked":"

What issues in particular are you having?

I’ve found 550s to be pretty reliable. Just be careful with the encoder cable, and maybe a touch of hot glue on the CAN bus connectors on the Spark Max.

To unplug the encoder cable, I usually use a small flathead screwdriver to kinda lever out each side of the connector a bit at a time, until it comes out.

Anyway, I’ve found once the 550 is installed, it’s reliable as any other motor.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T17:21:31.091Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":204,"readers_count":203,"score":130.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592060,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T17:22:20.454Z","cooked":"
viggy96:

I’ve found 550s to be pretty reliable.

With anything above a 15A current limit, I’ve found they’re likely to fail before a full season’s use. They’re also very sensitive to impacts and vibration.

Bigger motors are stronger. Scaling laws matter a lot.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T17:22:20.454Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":48.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592063,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T17:23:39.989Z","cooked":"

Hmm well at least in the application OP is talking about, where I’ve set a 20A limit (which I believe is the current limit suggested in the MAXSwerve template), I’ve never seen an issue. Several other neighboring teams also use MAXSwerve.

Only flaw with MAXSwerve I’ve seen is the motors are exposed, since they’re on the “top” of the module. So intakes or other appendages from other robots can hit them.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T17:25:34.199Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":178,"readers_count":177,"score":65.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592068,"name":"Ben Edwards","username":"beedward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beedward/{size}/111315_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T17:28:16.446Z","cooked":"

We’ve never burned one out, but we have pulled out the encoder wiring.
Ideally you want to be able to replace the 550 with something with an integrated motor controller like a kraken x44. But I think packaging that would be very non-trivial

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T17:28:16.446Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Ben Edwards","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37435,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"EE mentor"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592077,"name":"James Lyon","username":"Lyinlyon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lyinlyon/{size}/244534_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T17:33:45.600Z","cooked":"

Replacing The motor would be quite difficult on MAX swerve. Everything Below the Ultraplanetary system is custom hardware, and you would probably need to make your own. I’m not think sure if the Ultraplantary could handle a bigger motor.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T17:34:56.339Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"James Lyon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71354,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8410 Mechanical Lead "},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592116,"name":"Ben Edwards","username":"beedward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beedward/{size}/111315_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T18:04:05.874Z","cooked":"

Two possibilites, both difficult.
1 - adapt a NEO or SplineXS motor to use an Ultraplanetary input pinon. In theory I guess you could trim the shaft of a NEO and turn it down on a lathe to the correct diameter to take a press on pinion, ditto for a SplineXS motor. 3d printing probably won’t be strong enough I think for the pinion adapter. Then you’d use a 3d printed adapter to adapt the bolt circle of your whatever motor to the Ultraplanetary. This seems somewhat viable if weird. You could probably go down to a single 5:1 stage on the UP and I’m reasonably sure it would take the torque.
2 - Build your own custom gearbox that takes a NEO or SplineXS motor, with an interface to the big steering gear, replacing the Ultraplanetary completely.

I would say “if you want a compact swerve with a powerful steering motor, go buy a SwerveX2S”. Because while you CAN do one of these things to adapt the Maxswerve to use a non-550 steering motor, it will be hard, and unless you’re doing it just to say you can I don’t see the point.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T18:04:05.874Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Ben Edwards","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37435,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"EE mentor"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592390,"name":"Emmett Sisson","username":"emmettds","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T21:12:22.343Z","cooked":"

The pinions on a handful of them kept slipping (even after using a ton of loctite) meaning they would free spin frequently and we’d have to tear the entire mechanism apart. The UltraPlanetary mounting on the module would also loosen pretty quick, but that could’ve been a mistake on our part.

From what people have said, it seems like converting the turning motor into a non-550 might be a bit beyond my skillset at the moment. I appreciate all the input everyone has provided!!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T21:12:22.343Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"Emmett Sisson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65766,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3592476,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T22:31:20.349Z","cooked":"

The friction fit pinion, that you use an arbor press to get on? That seems like a manufacturing issue, the 550 pinion should stay on with no additional help from threadlocker.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T22:31:20.349Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"emmettds","name":"Emmett Sisson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/13edae/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3593120,"name":"","username":"ConnorMasini","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-15T15:45:12.395Z","cooked":"

We’ve run the same all of our 550’s at a 20 amp limit for 3+ seasons (including the 4 in our swerve modules) with absolutely no problems. Especially as the turning motor, there’s very little concern with burning out as there’s no expected situation where the motors are ever stalled (and with a 20 amp limit, you still have a long time before smoking a 550 even if you have a stalled wheel)

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-15T15:45:12.395Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65822,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6616 Coach"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3593125,"name":"","username":"ConnorMasini","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-15T15:50:19.665Z","cooked":"

It’s also fairly easy to replace the encoder wires if you do break them off, you just need a JST connector set, crimper and soldering iron (technically not necessary, but it makes it far easier). We even swapped one out in between matches at our first competition after a falling coral landed right on one of our encoder wires.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-15T15:50:19.665Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499265,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-turning-motor","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65822,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6616 Coach"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3593131,"name":"Xavier E.","username":"Xavbro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xavbro/{size}/6806_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-15T16:07:02.802Z","cooked":"

We’ve been using the MAXSwerve for 3 seasons now and our only issue with them have been the sensor wires from the motors and the encoder wire. We switched to NEO Vortexes and SparkFlexes this year and we loved it. I was really hoping REV would upgrade the 550s to not require the SparkMaxes but maybe in the future.

I don’t think the 550s are limiting anything on the MAXSwerve but I would like the ability to use another motor in place of it if possible.

Retaining compound may work better than regular threadlocker for a shaft slippage issue. That said, slipping shafts on a 550 pinion definitely sounds like a QA issue, certainly something to contact REV about if you see it more in the future.

We pulled one set of motor sense wires completely out of the motor- nothing left to solder or crimp to. Had to toss that one. Other sets of sense wires have broken and been repaired, mostly due to other robots getting into places we didn’t think possible.

FWIW i’ve seen this failure w/ press-fit pulleys on Neo550s before.

Retaining compound can help, but the shaft is pretty tiny. This is part of the “bigger motors are more robust” equation.
